member.name: T:AnimLib.Animations.Animation
member.summary:

One of these will be created for each you have in your mod, per player.

member.name: T:AnimLib.Animations.AnimationSource
member.summary: Contains all animation data for a single animation set. This animation data is used for all players. s from all mods are collected and created during . After initialization, values should not be modified.

member.remarks: This should only ever be used if a single on its own needs to use more than one spritesheet. This does not apply to cases where an needs more than one for its s, but rather, when a single needs more than one . If all of one can fit on a 2048x2048 spritesheet, use instead.

member.summary: Duration of the tile. If this value is , the animation will stay on this frame.

member.name: T:AnimLib.Animations.LoopMode
member.summary: Used to determine how a track behaves after its last frame is played.

member.name: F:AnimLib.Animations.LoopMode.None
member.summary: When the last frame ends, the animation remains on the last frame until the track changes.

member.name: F:AnimLib.Animations.LoopMode.Always
member.summary: When the last frame ends, the animation loops back to the start of the track.

member.name: F:AnimLib.Animations.LoopMode.Transfer
member.summary: When the last frame ends, the animation plays the specified track.

member.name: T:AnimLib.Animations.PlayerAnimationData

Your is automatically created by AnimLib when a player is initialized. To get your , use

member.name: M:AnimLib.Animations.PlayerAnimationData.Update
member.summary:
Updates the player animation by one frame. This is where you choose what tracks are played, and how they are played.
You must make calls to or its various overloads to continue or change the animation.

member.summary: Plays the with the given name. How the animation advances is based on the given input parameters.
member.param:
Name of the animation track to play/continue.
This must be a valid key in the for .

The frame to play, -or- to use the current .
A non- value prevents normal playback.

Speed to increase by, -or- to play at the default speed.
This must be a non-negative value. To play in reverse, use .

Duration of the frame, -or- to use the 's duration.
This must be a positive value.

Rotation of the sprite, in radians.
If degrees are necessary to work with, use for this parameter.
to play the track in, -or- , to use the current 's .

member.name: T:AnimLib.Animations.SwitchTextureFrame
member.summary: Single frame of animation that switches to another spritesheet. Stores sprite position on the sprite sheet, duration of the frame, and the next spritesheet to use.
member.remarks: This should only ever be used if a single needs to use more than one spritesheet. If all of one can fit on a 2048x2048 track, use that instead.
